text:
Hey all, practicing recovering from an identity backup in testnet and hit an issue with the new validator - is this related to expired validator onboarding token?
Things changed:
• In a fresh postgres db
• participant helm chart
    ◦ pointed to new db
• validator helm chart 
    ◦ participant-bootstrap-dump secret has been created
    ◦ pointed to new db
    ◦ new identity id has been set
    ◦ migrateValidatorParty is set to true
    ◦ wallet user is still the same

text: what about party hint?

Also I found this in our terraform
```  validation {
    condition     = !(var.canton_sensitive.validator_onboarding_secret != null && var.canton_sensitive.participant_identities_dump_json_file != null)
    error_message = "Both canton_sensitive.validator_onboarding_secret and canton_sensitive.participant_identities_dump_json_file should not be used together. canton_sensitive.validator_onboarding_secret is used for onboarding val
idator and canton_sensitive.participant_identities_dump_json_file is used to reonboard(restore) the validator using the participant identites dump"
  }```
onboarding token should not be used when recovering from backup

elements.text: Also I found this in our terraform
onboarding token should not be used when recovering from backup

text: party hint stayed the same, so do I need to restore back to the original secret value which I can?

elements.text: party hint stayed the same, so do I need to restore back to the original secret value which I can?

text: Onboarding token doesn't need to be specified. It's the opposite, restoration will fail if the token is configured.

elements.text: Onboarding token doesn't need to be specified. It's the opposite, restoration will fail if the token is configured.

text: This message was deleted.
Updated with the Disaster Recovery.
participant-bootstrap-dump definitely has private keys

Thx! It seems like Authentik and Auth0 both have their own unique concepts of what they consider an `Application` , then auth0 also has an abstraction it's calling an `API` , and Authentik seems to have a mapping between `Application`s and `Providers` -- My guess is (Using authentik's terminology) I want to:

Make an `Application` with a `Provider` , named `Daml Ledger API` (with the `offline_access` scope), then add a permission to it called `daml_ledger_api`
..But then I didn't understand what to do for what is labeled in the docs for auth0 instructions as `Validator app backend` (considered an `Application` in auth0 terms) or how to set up the web UI apps?
The authentik docs suggest that I usually want a 1:1 mapping of `application` to `Provider` but wasn't sure if each of these UI's is using the same `Provider` as the `Daml Ledger API` " `Application` " or they each have their own `Provider`
